entries: The Flurry, as it is referred to in the common tongue, is a large terrifying swarm of tentacles and ferocity found primarily in dense forests and jungles of the Known World. Flurry can lie dormant for months waiting for prey to walk near their hide. While motionless the Flurry is indistinguishable from the surrounding vines or roots of its environment using a limited chameleon like ability to change their color to blend in. The Flurry can also burrow into the ground and wait for unsuspecting prey to walk over their trap. Once the Flurry detects movement it bursts from its hide with lightening like quickness, ambushing its prey with a nightmarish whirlwind of multiple tentacle attacks.

These tentacles wrap around the target before the target even has a chance to react, causing panic and confusion. As targets try to flee, the Flurry hones in on their vibrations and takes chase. Once a target is grappled the Flurry begins draining its life force or slamming any creature trying to resist into unconsciousness. Targets can attempt to hide from the Flurry by remaining motionless (effectively making it "Blinded") but the tentacles will continue whipping around at everything within 10 feet as it tries to locate the intruder.

trait.name: Ambush
entries: While the Flurry remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a tangle of roots or vines. Until it moves the Flurry has a +10 to stealth. The Flurry has advantage on any creatures that have not yet acted.

trait.name: Tentacle Swarm
entries: The Flurry can use its entire turn to make a tentacle attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of it with a separate attack roll for each target. In addition the Flurry gets a tentacle attack as an attack of opportunity on any creature attempting to withdraw from melee.

trait.name: Life Drain
entries: The Flurry regains Hit Points equal to the amount of Necrotic damage sustained by a {@condition grappled} creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Flurry makes three attacks (if it has not used its turn to Tentacle Swarm.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is medium or smaller in size, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), {@condition restrained}, and takes 6 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage until the grapple ends.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
entries: The Flurry slams creatures {@condition grappled} by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a dc 14 constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the Flurry's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Throw
entries: The Flurry throws a creature it currently has {@condition restrained} up to 15 ft in any direction. Target takes 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must make a dc 13 dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
